reviews.text: This hotel was well-priced - and in an excellent location. Rue Massena is like a pedestrian street, with lots of restaurants, shops, and people around. It's about - 15 minutes walk from the train station towards the water side of Nice - my friend & myself were feeling a bit hot in the August heat walking with our 12kg backpacks, but we survived.
reviews.title: Great value & excellent location.

reviews.text: The staff were great, they all spoke English, and very helpful - e.g. we wanted ice, we wanted to put things in the fridge, we wanted to borrow some glasses & cutlery - all our wishes were granted. The breakfast was quite acceptable too - it's not buffet/hot food, but we did get a basket of croissants/buns and a wide range of spreads to choose from - and as much coffee & juice as we'd like. I'm quite a big eater and my tummy was happily satisfied with the breakfast provided. Compared to other hotels we stayed in in France, this was definitely a much better breakfast than most places, especially for a 2*.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.text: Pretty close to Vieux Nice too, and Galleries Lafayette is closeby too - I personally have no complaints - would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Excellent ratio of quality to price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really comment on sleep quality - I sleep easily everywhere and anywhere - but I think our room overlooked a back alley area anyway, so it was pretty quiet. We couldn't hear any noise from the bars/restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Can`t believe its only rated at 2 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must admit I don't quite share the total enthusiasm for this hotel detailed by other reviewers.
reviews.title: In the middle of everything

reviews.text: Our room was clean and roomy and the hotel overall is decorated nicely. We were given a room on the first floor on the rue Massena side. It was so loud we never slept the night through, even with the high quality windows shut and AC on. There were street performers well into the night and drunks after that. One night someone even broke a huge shop window across the way in a drunken game. When I asked to be moved to a room in the back I was told there were none. We were there for a week so it seems unlikely that nothing ever opened up. I was traveling with my son and suspected, rightly or wrongly, that a woman and child did not rate better accommodations.
reviews.title: Noisiest place I've ever tried to sleep.
Good value for money
reviews.text: Breakfast was pricey for the options so after a few days, we wandered down the street in the morning for something at a cafe and discovered the best pain au chocolat (chocolate croissant) I've ever had. I did like the endless refillable cups of coffee but at 9 euros each, or roughly $25 for breakfast I couldn't justify it. (I was desperate for take out coffee one morning so headed to the McDonald's on Promenade des Anglais. I was thrilled to discover they make a GREAT latte for a reasonable price. Unfortunately, it was the last day and when I searched for the same in Paris a week later I had no luck.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. The staff was friendly (except for my suspicions about why we got the room we did) but I probably would never go back.
reviews.title: Excellent location - great little hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Regence is very well located, close to beach, old town, restaurants and bars, shops, public transportation, ...
reviews.title: Clean, Good Value

reviews.text: Rooms are very clean and with the necessary comfort, including airconditioning and a free safe.
reviews.title: Excellent!
Nice, clean and well located
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights. It is ideally located and as stated in other reviews it is ideal if using as place to sleep / shower when touring Nice. It was spotless, the receptionist was very helpful, excellent value and we had no complaints.

With my wife and 4 friends I’ve just spent a long weekend at this hotel. On arrival at Nice Airport we took a bus from just outside the Arrivals terminal. The standard fare is 4 euros per person. You pay the driver as you board the bus. He issues the tickets and stamps them for you in the on board machine. The hotel is situated on Rue Messena. This is a traffic free street. As you travel along the sea front in Nice look out for the Casino on the left as the Rue Messena is quite close to it. It takes a few minutes to walk along Rue Messena to the hotel. Look out for a large vertical orange sign on the right hand side. The reception and public rooms were clean and tidy. The receptionist was very helpful and pleasant and we were quickly allocated our rooms. We found all the staff to be pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small and very basic. Furnishings were minimal the double bed and a small wardrobe occupying most of the space. Bed comfortable. Excellentand flexible lighting. A small flat screen TV is bolted to the wall but the only English channels are news related. The bathroom or rather the shower room was very clean and although basic had everything needed including soap dispensers by the sink and in the shower and a small hairdryer fixed to the wall. Plenty of hot water available and a good flush on the toilet. However, the towels were quite thin, not unusual in this class of hotel. Breakfast was very simple but adequate. Each diner was allocated a crusty bread roll, a small croissant and a Pan au Chocolate which were left in a basket on the table. Laughing Cow spread cheese portions, jam portions, honey portions and butter were available from the buffet along with tea, coffee and hot chocolate. All served from a push button machine. Orange and grapefruit juice were also dispensed from a machine but were of good quality. Extra bread etc. was available if you asked for it. The hotel’s location is ideal for walking to shops, the city squares and the sea front. It is a short walk to the clean and efficient tram service. The tram costs 1 euro per journey or you can buy one covering a number of days. Tickets are purchased from machines by the tram stops. Validate them on board by popping them into the yellow machines. The SNCF railway station is just a couple of stops from Rue Messena so it’s easy to get around. We visited Monaco, Cannes and Antibes by train with no difficulty whatsoever. All the train staff were very helpful. If you are not intending to go out in the evenings then this hotel is not for you. There is no bar nor are there any drinks available other than at breakfast. Eating out and drinking are very expensive at the nearby bars and restaurants and the food quality is indifferent to poor. However, I recommend walking to the old quarter where on the narrow streets small bistros provide adequate fare at a reasonable price. The Menu de Jour offers the best value. Alcoholic drinks are extremely expensive no matter where you go. This hotel provides a good base for exploring Nice and its surrounding area but it does have its limitations. I would use it again.
reviews.title: Nice in Nice?

reviews.text: Stayed at the Regence for 3 nights in October 2011 with my eldest son. I emailed them a few days beforehand to ask for a quiet twin room and this was what we got. The room was small and there was only just enough space to walk past the end of the beds. However it was spotlessly clean and the beds were comfortable. The aircon was very efficient and the blind ensured that the room was kept cool during the day and dark at night. The bathroom is also small but again had everything you need and was clean. The reception staff were very helpful and the public areas are very nice. Wi-fi was 3 euros for 24 hours. We had the breakfast a couple of days for convenience but found a small cafe down the street which was better and cheaper on the last day. Having stayed at a number of 3 star hotels in France, this 2 star beat them in every way. The location is spot on and near the old town and the promenade. Fully recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very central,300 yards from airport bus route stop(4euro per ticket but can be used all day on buses and trams just validate every time its used)Hotel room small,1 wardrobe,flat sreen TV can get BBC world news,Free safe easy to use,aircon very good,Bathroom:shower,heated towel rail,plenty of hot water.Breakfast:2 coffee machines,1 juice,1 basket of cobs,quasants,cakes jam etc.Rooms,bathroom,hotel very clean no smells,reception very helpful.Went buy bus to Monte Carlo cost 1 euro 1 way also to Cannes on train 8 euro return.Stayed 16th-19th Oct. No Problem.
reviews.title: No problem with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was clean, very well located, staff were friendly and accommodating. We booked through tripadvisor and they replied promptly . We felt very safe in the hotel and so very convienient.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Regence is a very well kept and clean 2 star in a amazing location. Staff was helpful and friendly, rooms were a decent size and very clean. The location is right off Nice's main pedestrian street with many many restaurants and bars. The only complaint I would have is the very basic breakfast (even for a 2 star), otherwise we enjoyed our stay here very much.
reviews.title: Solid 2 Star

reviews.text: After having read all the reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to book this lovely hotel! And I'm glad we did!!! It's right in the middle of everything.... an excellent starting point to see everything we wanted to in Nice and not only!
reviews.title: It exceeded our expectations!

reviews.text: As you walk in the reception hall, a friendly person always greets you and there is always someone there to help you with anything you need. Thanks to all the people at the front desk for their help.
reviews.title: Basic and Near the Beach

reviews.text: The rooms were in excellent condition, very clean, spacious enough and the bathroom spotless clean every day! Although the hotel is on one of the busiest streets, it is really quiet, even the rooms with a view to the street, thanks to the windows. Once they close you can't hear a thing!
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was the breakfast which we decided to have on the first day. It's an extra 6 euros but not worth it as there were only a couple of bread rolls and croissants on each table for every 2 people and a choice of jams and butter. And of course coffee.... but that's it!!!!
reviews.title: Great Value and Location
